materials: COATS® Crème De La Crème®: 1 ball each 810 Tile Blue A and 984 Bluetones B
small decorative button for Blossom Bib (optional)
measurements: Bib measure 9” (22.9 cm) wide x 7” (17.8 cm) to neck
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Trim
Round 1: With right side facing, attach B at lower left corner; ch 1, sc around bib, taking care to keep work flat; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, Reverse sc to center of first tab, turn to work sc around inside neck edge to top edge of 2nd tab, ch 4 for button loop, skip 3 sc, sc in next sc, turn to complete outside edge in Reverse sc; join. Fasten off.
With sewing needle and thread, attach button to tab without chain loop.
Car
Following directions included with the French Knitter, make 18” (45.7 cm) of I-cord with B leaving an 18” (45.7 cm) tail at beginning and end. Roll ends of I-cord into wheel shapes and the remaining length in a car shape following photo. Secure to bib with yarn tails. Add backstitch detail following photo.

BIB
Ch 17.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Hdc, sc) all in 3rd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch; (sc, hdc) all in last ch; turn – 17 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) in first st, sc in each st to last st; (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn –19 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until there are 31 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Repeat last row until 7” (17.8 cm) from beginning, end wrong side row.
Divide for Neck: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc; TURN. 
Decrease 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 1, decrease, sc in next 4 sts, (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Decrease at each end of next 2 rows – 3 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, draw up a loop in next 3 sts, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – 1 st. Fasten off.
With right side facing, skip center 7 sc, attach yarn in next sc; ch 1, sc in next 12 sc; turn. 
Decrease 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) all in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, decrease over last 2 sc; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Complete same as first tab.
Designed by Joan Barnett

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9600 White A and 9700 Baby Pink B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bib measures 10½” [26.5 cm] at widest point x 11” [28 cm] at longest point
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 10 rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in any dc after a ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in the next 11 sts, rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Shape Points 2-4
Join yarn in next ch-1 space and work as for First Point. 

Shape Right Neck Strap
Row 1: With right side facing, skip 3 sts to left of center unworked ch-1 space, join yarn in next st, ch 3, dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next ch-1 space – 10 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st to last 2 sts, dctog – 9 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 10 sts.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3. 
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 9 sts.
Row 7: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 4 sts, [dc2tog] twice – 7 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across, ch 14.
Row 9: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 10 ch, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc2tog – 17 sts. Fasten off.

Shape Left Neck Strap
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in next ch-1 space to right of center unworked ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in next 9 sts – 10 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 10 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog, dc in each st across – 9 sts.

BIB
Star Center
With A, ch 4, slip st in beginning ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in ring, *ch 1, 2 dc in ring; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 1, slip st in top of ch 3 – 18 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next st, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in ch-1 space, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-1 space, slip st in top of ch 3 – 30 sts. Fasten off. 
Round 3: Join A in any ch-1 space, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same space, *dc in each dc to next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 4 more times, dc in each dc to first st, slip st in 3rd of ch-4 – 42 sts.
Rounds 4-6: Slip st in ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same space, *dc in each dc to next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 4 more times, dc in each dc to first st, slip st in 3rd of ch 4 – 78 sts on last round. 
Fasten off.

Shape Star Points
First Point
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in any dc after a ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in the next 11 sts, rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

FINISHING
Sew Crown in center of Bib.
Bib Edging
With right side facing, join A in top of Right Neck Strap, sc evenly spaced around outside and neck edges of Bib, ch 3 for button loop, slip st in first st.
Sew button opposite button loop on Left Neck Strap. 
Weave in ends.

materials: COATS® Crème De La Crème®: 1 ball each 701 Orchid Pink A and 983 Baby Pastels Print B
Small decorative button for Blossom Bib (optional)
measurements: Bib measure 9” wide x 7” (4.9 x 17.8 cm) to neck
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Trim
Rnd 1: With right side facing, attach B at lower left corner; ch 1, sc around bib, taking care to keep work flat; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, Reverse sc to center of first tab, turn to work sc around inside neck edge to top edge of 2nd tab, ch 4 for button loop, skip 3 sc, sc in next sc, turn to complete outside edge in Reverse sc; join. Fasten off. With sewing needle and thread, attach button to tab without chain loop.
Flower
Following directions included with the French Knitter, make 18” (45.7 cm) of I-cord with B leaving an 18” (45.7 cm) tail at beginning and end. Form a 5-petal flower with I-cord and attach securely to bib with tail. Sew on decorative button (optional).
SPECIAL STITCH
Decrease = draw up a loop in next 2 sts, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
BIB
Ch 17.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Hdc, sc) all in 3rd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch; (sc, hdc) all in last ch; turn – 17 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) in first st, sc in each st to last st; (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn –19 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until there are 31 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Repeat last row until 7” (17.8 cm) from beginning, end wrong side row.
Divide for Neck: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc; TURN. Dec 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 1, decrease, sc in next 4 sts, (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Decrease at each end of next 2 rows – 3 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, draw up a loop in next 3 sts, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – 1 st. Fasten off.
With right side facing, skip center 7 sc, attach yarn in next sc; ch 1, sc in next 12 sc; turn. Decrease 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) all in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, decrease over last 2 sc; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Complete same as first tab.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream (Solids 2.5 oz/70.9 g/Ombres 2 oz/56.7 g)
Size 4.50 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
With MC, ch 20. 
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 18 sts. Ch 2. Turn. 
2nd row: 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each st to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Ch 2. Turn. Rep last row 3 times more. 26 sts. Cont even until work from beg measures 6 ins [15 cm] ending with RS facing for next row. 
Shape neck: 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in each of first 9 sts. Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – hdc2tog made. Ch 2. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Ch 2. Turn. 
3rd row: 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Ch 2. Turn. Rep last 2 rows once more. 6 sts. 
6th and 7th rows: 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Ch 2. Turn. 
8th row: 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Ch 2. Turn. 
9th row: Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 2 hdc in last st. Ch 2. Turn. Rep last 2 rows once more, then 8th row once omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. With RS of work facing, miss next 4 sts. Join MC with ss to next st. Ch 2. Hdc2tog over this st and next st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Ch 2. Turn. Work to correspond to first side, reversing all shapings. 
Edging: Join A with ss to top left corner of neck edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. Work 1 row sc evenly around all edges. Join with ss to first sc. 
Next row: Working around outer edge only, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. *Miss next sc. [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] all in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around to opposite corner at back neck. Fasten off. Sew button at back neck.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - dc2tog made
instructions: Front: With MC, ch 33. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 31 dc. 2nd row: Ch 3. Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Rows 1 and 2 of chart are complete. Beg with row 3, work chart to end of chart reading rs rows from right to left and Ws rows from left to right, noting each row ends with ch 3. Turn. next 2 rows: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Ch 3. Turn. shape neck: next row: (RS). Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc (neck edge). Ch 3. t urn. Leave rem sts unworked. next row: Miss first dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Ch 3. Turn. next row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Turn. 7 dc. Work 3 rows even in dc omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. With RS of work facing, miss next 11 dc. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 3. next row: Miss first dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Turn. next row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to last 3 dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Ch 3. Turn. next row: Miss first dc. Dc2tog over next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Turn. 7 dc. Work 3 rows even in dc omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. Back: Ch 33. 1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 31 dc. Ch 3. Turn. 2nd row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Ch 3. Turn. Rep last row 14 times more omitting turning ch at end of last row (16 rows total). next row: Miss first dc. 1 dc in each of next 14 dc (back opening). Ch 3. t urn. Leave rem sts unworked. Work 5 more rows in dc omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. With RS of work facing, miss next dc. Join yarn with sl st to next dc. Ch 3. next row: 1 dc in first dc and each dc to end of row. Ch 3. turn. Work 5 more rows in dc omitting turning ch at end of last row. Fasten off. Finishing: Sew shoulder seams. With RS of work facing, join yarn with sl st at bottom of back opening. Ch 1. Work sc evenly up back opening, around neck and down other side of back opening. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Border: 1st rnd: With RS of work facing join A with sl st at center of Back. Ch 1. Work 14 sc to corner. Work 3 sc in corner. Work 87 sc evenly along side. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 29 sc evenly across lower front edge. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 87 sc evenly along side. Work 3 sc in next corner. Work 14 sc across to center back. Join with sl st to first sc. 243 sc. 2nd rnd: 1 sc in first st. *Miss next st. 5 dc in next st. Miss next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Miss next st. 5 dc in next st. Miss next st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Medium, Art. E404 Oeko-Tex Certified 100% Acrylic baby yarn available in solid color 4.5 oz (127 g), 247 yd (225 m) balls; multis 4 oz (113 g), 208 yd (190 m) balls
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work direction in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: About 8½" long (from top neck band edge to bottom point) x 9" wide (at widest point) [21 cm x 23 cm]
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows sc = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NECK RIBBING
Ch 4 (5, 5).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—3 (4, 4) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Rows 3-45 (51, 54): Repeat Row 2. At end of last Row, do not turn; fasten off.
BIB
Row 1 (Right Side): Skip first 15 (17, 17) side Rows of Ribbing and join yarn. Ch 1, sc in same side Row, 2 sc in next side Row, sc in next 13 (15, 17) side Rows; turn—16 (18, 20) sc.
Rows 2-5 (2-7, 2-8): Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in remaining sc across; turn—20 (24, 27) sc.
Rows 6-10 (8-12, 9-14): Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 11-28 (13-34, 15-39): Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc across; turn—2 (2, 2) sc.
Row 29 (35, 40): Ch 1, sc2tog; fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Seam beginning and ending Neck Ribbing Rows together. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9600 White A and 9800 Baby Blue B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Bib measures 10½” [26.5 cm] at widest point x 11” [28 cm] at longest point.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 10 rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com

I’m the Prince Bib
Crochet this dressy dinner bib with elegant crown appliqué. Baby will look precious and mommy will love that it is easily washed.

leave remaining sts unworked – 12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, sc2tog, sc across to last 3 sts, sc2tog, sc in top of ch 3 – 10 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3 – 8 sts. 
Row 6: Repeat Row 2 – 6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 3, turn, [dc2tog] twice, dc in last st – 4 sts. Fasten off.

Shape Points 2-4
Join yarn in next ch-1 space and work as for First Point. 

Shape Right Neck Strap
Row 1: With right side facing, skip 3 sts to left of center unworked ch-1 space, join yarn in next st, ch 3, dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next ch-1 space – 10 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st to last 2 sts, dct2tog – 9 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 10 sts.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3. 
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st – 9 sts.
Row 7: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 4 sts, [dc2tog] twice – 7 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across, ch 14.
Row 9: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 10 ch, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc2tog – 17 sts. Fasten off.

Shape Left Neck Strap
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in next ch-1 space to right of center unworked ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in next 9 sts – 10 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 10 sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc2tog, dc in each st across – 9 sts.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc2tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook
Dc3tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook

BIB
Star Center
With A, ch 4, slip st in beginning ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in ring, *ch 1, 2 dc in ring; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 1, slip st in top of ch 3 – 18 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next st, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in ch-1 space, dc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-1 space, slip st in top of ch 3 – 30 sts. Fasten off. 
Round 3: Join A in any ch-1 space, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same space, *dc in each dc to next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 4 more times, dc in each dc to first st, slip st in 3rd of ch-4 – 42 sts.
Rounds 4-6: Slip st in ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in same space, *dc in each dc to next ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 4 more times, dc in each dc to first st, slip st in 3rd of ch 4 – 78 sts on last round. 
Fasten off.

Shape Star Points
First Point
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in any dc after a ch-1 space, ch 3, dc in the next 11 sts, rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet.

RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®, Art. E746 available in solid color 5 oz (141 g), 256 yd (234 m); prints 4 oz (113 g), 204 yd (187 m) balls
Designed by Sharon Mann
What you will need:
RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9600 White A and 9800 Baby Blue B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5]
12mm button, stitch marker, yarn needle

GAUGE: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 10 rows = 5” [12.5 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

CROCHET
SKILL LEVEL
EASY

SHOP KIT
I’M THE PRINCE BIB | CROCHET    1 of 2


Row 4: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st across – 10 sts.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 9 sts.
Row 7: Ch 3, turn, [dc2tog] twice, dc in each st across – 7 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog. Fasten off.
Row 9: With right side facing, join A in first st of Row 8, ch 13. Fasten off. 
Join A in last st of Row 8, sc2tog, hdc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, dc in remaining 13 ch – 17 sts. Fasten off. 

CROWN
With B, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next st, *ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 12 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in first st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in next st, [dc3tog all in next st] 3 times, hdc in next st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in next st, dc3tog all in next st, hdc in last st.
Row 5: Ch 6, turn, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 8, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 8, skip 2 sts, sc in next st, ch 6, sc in last st. 
Fasten off.
Row 6: Join B in last st of Row 5, ch 1, work 6 sc in ch-6 space, [work 8 sc in next ch-8 space] twice, 6 sc in next ch-6 space, slip st in first st of Row 5. 
Fasten off.
Row 7: Join B in space in between ch-8 spaces on Row 5, (ch 3, dc3tog, ch 3, slip st) all in same st. 
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Crown in center of Bib.
Bib Edging
With right side facing, join A in top of Right Neck Strap, sc evenly spaced around outside and neck edges of Bib, ch 3 for button loop, slip st in first st.
Sew button opposite button loop on Left Neck Strap. 
Weave in ends
